title: Number of homicide offences in England and Wales 2002 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of homicides offences, with a total of 17 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018/19 to 2013/14.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2007/08 to 2002/03.
Differently, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2013/14 to 2011/12.
Additionally, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2011/12 to 2009/10.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2009/10 to 2007/08.
gold: How many homicides are registered in England and Wales ? There were 701 homicides recorded in England and Wales in 2018/19 , slightly fewer than in the previous reporting year of 2017/18 , when there were 728 homicides . Between 2002/03 and 2013/14 the number of homicides in England and Wales almost halved from over 1 thousand to just over 530 . The recent rise in the number of homicides has occurred alongside an increase in the overall number of crimes , with police officials linking this to long-term cuts to their manpower and resources .
